column1: good length, angled across outside off, left alone
back of a length outside, dragged through the leg side, not off the middle, towards deep midwicket
nice delivery, shapes back from short of a length, Gayle shoulders arms and it's quite a tight leave
taken at first slip! Excellent delivery, in the channel outside off, across the left hander, takes the outside edge and it's a neat catch to his left by Joe Root
short of a length, angled into the pads and that's a neat clip through midwicket to get off the mark
that's a loose drive! Adjusts his line and length, full outside off, Hope comes forward to drive and is beaten by some late nibble
starts round the wicket to Lewis, speared down the leg side
full outside off, gets forward and a drive skews off a thickish edge down to third man
short of a length at off stump, nips back off the seam, tucked behind square on the leg side
fuller, at the stumps, squeezed to mid-on
an appeal for caught behind, a little belated from the bowler...was short of a length, shaped back at Hope and skimmed past the outside. Hope may have clipped his pad
good delivery, at off stump, takes a thick outside edge into the gully area
full from round the wicket, a forcing shot takes more inside edge than middle but races down to fine leg where there is no cover
top shot! He's timed that wonderfully, presses forward into a full delivery and sends it straight of mid-on
drags the length back, outside off, defended with soft hands towards third slip
another good-looking drive, straight to mid-off
pulls his bat inside the line of a short-of-a-length delivery outside off

given caught behind, but he reviews instantly. Nice delivery, just outside off on a good length forcing him to play. Well, there's a big spike on UltraEdge so this will stay out! Not sure what Hope thought, bat was well away from pad on this occasion
full outside off, Samuels shuffles across the crease and dabs into backward point...almost confusion over the run, Lewis charging down but Marlon not going anywhere
and now Ball beats the edge (with a good ball). Round the wicket, back of a length, Lewis trying to get forward
squared up a touch with a delivery on off stump, defended to point
across onto off stump and tucks this into the midwicket area
short of a length outside off, defended to the leg side
good length outside off, left alone
this is full, shapes back nicely but started wide enough to be left alone
at off stump, back of a length, defended
touch shorter, not too much width but that's very nicely put away with a strong square drive wide of point
straightens the line, short of a length, worked to the leg side
an appeal for lbw as he shuffles across and misses the flick, was quite short so looked to have pitched outside leg..ah, given runs as well
defended towards mid-on
a fraction fuller, at middle and off, defended to the on side
another appeal for lbw, Samuels a long way across his crease...maybe a bit high, could be outside the line as well. Going over
pushes towards mid-off and takes the single, need much more of that from Samuels
round the wicket, full outside off, left alone
short of a length, gets inside the line and tucks it off his hip behind square
that's a very strong drive, Ball gets to full at off stump, Lewis drills it straight of mid-off
pulls the length back, defended to the covers

this time he's given! No review left. Once again he goes right across his crease, misses as he aims to work to the leg side. Taken above the knee roll. Straight enough, but was it high? Umpire's call on height. Clipping the bails
full outside off, gets onto the front foot and knocks into the covers
short of a length at off stump, punched to cover
flicks a straight delivery to deep square leg
full outside off, left alone
he picks out the only man in front of square on the off side, at cover, as he defends on the front foot
over the wicket, full at off stump, 85mph and driven to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, pushed towards mid-on for a sharpish single
that's a wild slash, his eyes lit up at some width outside off but the ball nipped back off the seam
gets forward and there's a misfield at cover by Morgan to allow the single
that's flayed through the covers, width offered, an expansive square drive with his front leg in the air and it whistles away
pushed off the back foot between cover and mid-off
short of a length, punched off the back foot to mid-off
a somewhat strangled appeal for lbw, Lewis trapped on the crease but was there an inside edge? Yes, nicked into the pads
good shape from the batsman again as he plays off the back foot to mid-off
some extra bounce on this one, from quite a full length, Lewis whips the bottom hand off the bat
on the back foot again, drives to the covers
that's a super whip-pull through the leg side, excellent timing and placement
full at off stump, well driven between cover and mid-off...a little floaty with that first delivery
pushed down the leg side
and another wide, a shorter delivery, angled well down the leg side
on the pads, flicked behind square and deep square leg can't stop the second
full and straight, pushed to mid-on...88mph
full length, angled into the pads, clipped wide of mid-on
good length at middle and off, hits the bat hard as Lewis defends towards mid-on
short of a length at off stump, 85mph, punched off the back foot to mid-off
straight, pushed to midwicket
fuller, line is outside off, driven into the covers where Morgan dives
gets forward and defends to backward point
outside off, pushed back to the bowler
dragged down a touch short, he goes for the pull and gets a bottom edge straight down by his feet

dropped, on rebound! Morgan nearly got it on the second attempt. A stinging drive towards cover, above Morgan's head, he couldn't grab it one handed with a leap but nearly swiveled to grab it behind him
pushed into midwicket
short of a length at off stump, 85mph, defended back to the bowler
defended to mid-off
short delivery, neatly pulled to deep square leg
full outside off, he goes to leave this but is late withdrawing the bat and runs off the face to third man
pushed down the leg side, Plunkett's third wide
back of a length at off stump, defended
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended to cover
gets onto the front foot and drives to that same man at cover
fuller, at middle and leg, nearly gets a leading edge as plays back to the bowler
this takes an inside edge out to deep square and is actually worth a couple in the end
pushed with a straight bat down to long-on
short of a length, Moeen skips across in his follow through to field
short of a length, goes for the pull, not quite out of the middle to deep square
short outside off, defended to point
short of a length, a bottom-handed flick back down the pitch
short, wide outside off, a powerful square cut out to deep cover
round the wicket, short of a length, punched to cover
short again, that's a fantastic shot as he fetches it from outside off and pulls through straight midwicket
tucked from off stump down to long-on
round the wicket, full and straight, eased down the ground
opens the face to a delivery outside off and finds backward point
fuller, driven off the front foot to long-off
played down to long-off again
shorter, he rocks back and picks out the man at cover. Feels he missed out
round the wicket, quite a round-arm delivery, slung in at the stumps and driven down the ground
on off stump, defended to cover
fuller, gives himself a fraction of room and drives it very sweetly through the covers
shorter, flatter, on the pads and tucked to midwicket
full outside off, driven to cover
too full this time, driven wide of the man at cover this time and finds plenty of space in the deep
tossed up, maybe the googly and it slides down the leg side for a wide
full, up in the blockhole, Mohammed tamps down on it
tossed up, the legbreak straightens on middle and off, defended
gives this a bit more air and drift, tapped to the on side
flighted on off stump, Mohammed blocks from the crease
goes a touch short, worked through square leg for a single off the back foot
stays over the wicket to the southpaw, tossed up on middle and leg, Lewis sweeps for one
round the wicket, tossed up and belted but straight to extra cover
full, dipping on off, driven into the ground back to the bowler
flatter and on the pads, worked back to the on side and Moeen fields
floated up on the stumps and pinged down the ground for one this time
over the wicket, pushed through outside off, punched square from the crease
tossed up and Mohammed goes back and nudges to leg, no wiggle room for a run there
floated up on off stump, punched back down the ground
full and flighted, stifled lbw appeal as Mohammed goes down on one knee to sweep... probably turning enough, but think it pitched outside leg
on the stumps, tapped towards midwicket
gives it some air and Mohammed blocks again
floated up, Mohammed attempts to hit his way out, sends the ball back to the bowler
flatter outside off, sits back and cracks a cut through point
tossed up and launched over extra cover, nicely played and it bounces away for a welcome boundary
comes forward and tickles one down the ground
flighted, tempting him forward to drive, can't get it past extra cover
full and this is pushed into a gap down the ground, fifty up for Lewis, for the second time in ODIs
dragged down a touch and Mohammed pulls firmly to deep midwicket
darted in on the stumps, clipped down to long-on
pushed through, grips a touch and hits high up the bat as Lewis defends
flighted, on the stumps, nudged back past the bowler
pushed through, outside off and Mohammed chops into a gap for a couple
straighter, sliding on to the pads and nurdled around the corner - up comes the Windies 100, to polite applause
floated up full but it's leg side and Lewis sends it flashing away fine with a well-directed sweep for four
lovely shot! This is a touch short from Rashid and Lewis stands tall to rattle a back-foot drive past cover and away to the rope for back-to-back boundaries
on the stumps, worked behind square on the leg side
tossed up outside off from round the wicket, lets this one go
nicely played again, deft touch from Lewis as he drops back and uses the pace on the ball, gliding four more to third man
flighted, outside off, punched to extra cover
angled in on the stumps, tapped into a gap
flat trajectory, taken off the pads through square
floated up in the channel, Mohammed clunks a drive into the covers and they come back for two
gets on to the front foot and pinches a couple more with a drive into the deep
floated up, driven firmly but cut off inside the ring this time
straightens the legbreak on middle and leg, tucked to the on side
pushed through outside off, Mohammed drops back and dabs the ball square
flighted, uses the feet and drives, wide of long-off and he gets two more
short ball, thudding into the pitch, Lewis cuts wide of the sweeper for a couple
dug in and swatted off the back foot to deep cover
bumper, taken on the back foot for one with a pull through square
good length, slower ball, 75mph and blocked into the off side
shortish, scrambling seam, I think, worked away off the pads from back in the crease
splice-juddering length over off stump, Mohammed shows it a straight bat
rolls his arm over, dipping and straightening as the bat scissors down, prodded back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, tapped into the covers
flat delivery, Mohammed drills through the off side
slider from Rashid but it sits up wide of the stumps for Lewis to thrash his hands through a chunky cut in front of square
full on leg stump, can't get the sweep past short fine leg
tossed up, a touch straight but Lewis sweeps straight to short fine leg once again
back of a length in the corridor, Mohammed rides the bounce and steers down to third man
dug in short, Lewis pulls and it comes of the thigh pad, looping into the leg side and they scamper through
short ball, sliding down the leg side
back of a length in the channel and Mohammed cuts a single through point
Lewis shows intent early here, stepping down the pitch and driving on the up, Root does well to stop it running wide of mid-on as he gives chase and throws himself full length
dug in, 87mph but down the leg side and Mohammed only has to tickle it fine to get four
back of a length, 88mph outside off and tapped to short extra cover
pushed through down the leg side, not all that far from hitting leg stump as Lewis sweeps and misses - but still called wide
tossed up and cut for a single
Mohammed comes forward to defend
flighted, again met on the front foot in front of off stump
quicker, in the channel and chopped through point playing back
loopy legbreak, on the pads and Lewis can work it into a gap at deep midwicket for two
pushed flat and quicker outside off, Lewis swats it to extra cover
short of a length, wide from Plunkett and cut through the covers
cutting his fingers over the ball, Lewis mistimes a back-foot punch but they steal one into the off side
back of a length outside off and driven square
tight lines, Plunkett seems to be finding his groove again, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length, slightly straighter and punched towards mid-on
hammers a length outside off, Mohammed can only prod to cover - just two singles off the over
tossed up, down the leg side again
full and flighted, slightly leg side and chipped through mid-on for one

dragged down, Mohammed drops back to cut but nicks to the keeper! Possibly off the toe, an audible edge, though, and Buttler's immediate celebration was followed by Rod Tucker's finger going up. England have the breakthrough
tossed up full and punched down the ground for one to get Holder off the mark
flatter, worked with the spin off the stumps
floated up full, Holder strokes another single through mid-off
gives this some air, gripping on off stump, leans into a front-foot block
fired in straight, hitting the pads as Holder hangs back, Plunkett appeals... but looked leg side
banged in short, again taking the pace off, Lewis paddles a single through square leg
shuffles across and worked through midwicket
dug in short and worked off the body for another single

dropped! But it was a fantastic effort from Morgan in the covers...! He flew to his left as Holder hit an aerial drive, seemed to claim the catch but it was dislodged as he came back down and his arms hit the turf
angled in straight, Holder defends this time
again Rashid starts an over by sliding one down the leg side
tossed up and pushed back down the track
flatter, driven off the back foot to long-off
floated up full outside off, Holder uses his long reach to get forward and skelp a drive, placed wide of long-off and even the scurrying legs of Bairstow can't cut the ball off
tossed up on off stump, blocked
prodded in front of square but he decides against running
Holder gets forward and nudges one more down the ground
in the channel, run away through backward point with an one bat face
short, Ball grunts in exertion, pulled away into a gap in the leg side and they come back for two
round the wicket, fullish on middle and off but Lewis isn't forward and his drive runs to midwicket off the inside edge
angled in straight, flicked down to fine leg
oof, length ball on off, 84mph and Ball throws his hands up as Holder inside-edges through his legs
speared in, no width for Lewis, who prods into the off side
full on the stumps, pushed back past the bowler
looped up, slightly leg side and Lewis gets his sweep away
rolled out on off, Holder prods into the covers
touch short, Holder stays back and works a single away into the leg side
short again and this is belted back past mid-off, powerfully struck by Lewis, who moves into the 90s
pushed through and tapped back to the bowler
short of a length outside off, Holder rocks back to cut
Ball hits the middle of the pitch, driven off the back foot, into a gap in the covers and they hare back as the throw comes in
slower ball from Ball, cutting his fingers down the side, nudged off the pads square for one more
back of a length, 86mph and angling in with the arm, Holder runs it down to third man
pitched up straight and driven to mid-off, who's back far enough that they can trot through for one
short of a length, Holder top-edges a pull in the air... but it lands out of reach, went square and Moeen couldn't make it across from midwicket
back of a length on off, patted towards extra cover
fuller, Holder steps out an drives on the up, supremely well timed and although Billings goes hurtling around the rope he can't prevent four with a dive
good length, closer to the stumps, dabbed down square
angled in straight and worked to the leg side for a single
short and leg side, Lewis rocks back and pulls fine, that's running away... second ODI hundred for Lewis, been a fine knock, applauded by his team-mates and the Oval crowd. Can he keep going?
four more, again pulled to the fence! The runs flowing as Woakes starts to leak after his excellent opening spell
back of a length at off stump, 84mph, defended off an inside
touch fuller, at middle and off, pushed to mid-on
wider outside off, driven to the cover sweeper
round the wicket, back of a length, punched to deep cover
full and straight, small hint of movement in at Holder who nudges to mid-on
good length at off stump, defended
full and straight, 85mph, driven to mid-on who is able to get across to cut off the single
on the pads, flicked to deep square leg and that's the fifty stand
back of a length at off stump, driven from the back foot to cover
that's a sharp bouncer, well-directed over middle and leg, Lewis in two minds whether to hook or leave and in the end makes a late decision to get underneath
pitches further up at off stump, can't beat the man at cover
short ball, hooks this time down to long leg
angled in from round the wicket, takes an inside edge to long leg
gets away with this as he pulls at a short delivery, gets a bottom edge which scoots past the stumps
a slower short ball, sits up outside off, Lewis connects sweetly with a clubbing pull but Bairstow does well at deep square
goes for the yorker at off stump, a low full toss which just costs a single to deep cover
short of a length at the hip, Lewis pulls off one leg
full and straight, plays forward and works to midwicket on the edge of the ring
back of a length at off stump, tucked to midwicket
that's a meaty blow, shifts his front leg out of the way to open the stance then swings a back-of-a-length delivery wide of long-on
back outside off, angled to backward point
fuller, outside off, driven to mid-off
direct hit from mid-off, by Root, as Holder drives and runs...his long strides help him get in comfortably
short of a length, cut in the air but lands just short of Roy at point
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
nice bit of a touch as he opens the face and guides a length delivery to third man
just has the legs for six! Top edge from a short ball, looked to have straight up initially but it kept carrying towards the long leg boundary and evades Rashid. First six of the innings
and now the second of the innings! That's a brilliant shot. A dismissive drive straight down the ground from a perfectly respectable good-length delivery
defends the length ball this time, back to the bowler
full at off stump, another sweet drive, along the ground this time and finds mid-off
full at the stumps, driven through the covers
short outside off, Lewis rocks back and drives to deep cover
goes for the reverse sweep, gets a bottom edge which dribbles to short third man

dropped, but that would have been a good one from Roy! Lewis came down the pitch, didn't pick the googly, sent it high over the off side. Roy ran back from cover and nearly took it brilliantly over his shoulder
much more in control of this one! Down the pitch again, lofts it high towards deep midwicket, wide of the fielder, and it goes into the boundary-marker on the full
this scoots away fine, goes back to cut and gets a bottom edge into Buttler's knee and it scuttles away...expensive over
pushed through quickly into the pads
a thunderous straight blow by Holder this time, a skimming drive, and another one pitches straight into the boundary marker
flatter, quicker, worked down the ground to long-on
round the wicket, very wide outside off
at off stump, driven down to long-off
that's a long way back! Skips down the track and it's a mighty clean strike over wide long-on. Taking advantage of the spinners
round the wicket, connects nicely with a reverse sweep but picks out point
back of a length, slugged to deep midwicket
he follows Holder who moves outside leg stump, bunted down to long-on
terrific shot! Short ball from Woakes, Lewis whips through a pull shot and sends it skimming over deep square leg
fuller, at the stumps, pushed to mid-off who hits direct but pretty sure Holder is got back. Yep, gets a long stretch out
moves outside leg stump, cramped for a room a touch as Woakes bangs it in outside leg
another crowd catch! What a way to reach his fifty...off 47 balls. Gives himself a touch of room and lofts a good-length delivery over long-on. A punch of the air by the captain
offers up width from round the wicket, flayed over the covers
and that's his 150 with a slog sweep, goes down on his back knee and comfortably clears the boundary...a new career-best, 26 balls for the third fifty
now over the wicket, almost finds long-off but just has the power to clear Plunkett even though it came from near the bottom of the bat
speared full and fast outside off, driven to deep cover
stand and deliver! Magnificent striking from Lewis...wide outside off, throws his hands through the drive to deep point
that's the pressure, fired full outside leg stump
round the wicket, fired full outside off, clubbed to long-on
what a way to cross 300! Full, angled into the pads, clears the front leg and sends it over deep midwicket almost with a straight bat
full outside off, low full toss, driven to deep cover
a slower short ball from round the wicket, and it's pulled over deep square leg...not stopping Lewis
straight full toss clubbed down to long-on
full, wide outside off, thick outside down to third man
full at off stump, swung to deep midwicket and they get back for the second
a slower short ball, pulled to deep square off the toe end
that's a rare sight, a yorker, outside off and Lewis plays over the top of it
full outside off, driven to long-off
follows him outside leg with a full delivery which is then driven to long-off
full and straight, gets his feet out of the way and digs it out down the ground to long-on
back of a length, a cutter I think, dragged out to deep midwicket...a very good over from Plunkett
full at off stump, opens the face and runs it down to third man

well bowled, gets the yorker in from round the wicket and knocks Lewis off his feet. He's in some pain here. Taken on the heel. Rolling around in significant discomfort here. Actually, it took inside edge into the foot
gets the yorker in, dug out to the off side
length ball at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
full at leg stump, that's a strong clip off his toes and deep square leg can't get across
full outside off, pushed back to Ball who gets a hand on it in his follow through but it dribbles away from him
round the wicket, full toss, flicked back to the bowler
pushed across outside off, keeps it full, played to the covers
moves outside leg, fired in full and fast, clipped to deep midwicket
full outside leg stump, worked off the pads through square leg and sees the chance for the second
full outside off, pushed to deep cover
miscues a thick inside edge through the leg side but the lack of timing helps him get back for the second
wide outside off, full, not time at all as he plays to the covers
that's superbly played, wasn't far off on target with the wide yorker, Holder opens the face and slices it behind point, wide of third man
full and wide, driven square through point and third man is squarer now, more deep point, after that previous shot
that's a super stroke, walks across his crease and picks up a full delivery with a strong bottom-handed flick
back outside off, a yorker, pushed down to long-off
a very wide full toss, Holder already across onto off stump, pops it towards cover off the toe end
full and straight, pushed down the ground to long-on
swings across the line of a short-of-a-length delivery and gets a top edge over the keeper
beats with a yorker outside leg stump as he gives himself room to the leg side
that's crunched! Banged in short and Powell swings it over deep midwicket
that's more like it, a yorker at the stumps, dug out to the on side
full toss taken at deep midwicket, doesn't quite have the legs to finish the innings with a six...Billings safely under it
back of a length and stabbed through the covers, Roy controls the drive nicely and picks up three from his first ball
ooh, good ball, rising and nipping away as Bairstow hangs a bat out and is beaten... half and appeal for an edge but not convincing
length, 83mph in the channel, prodded down in front of square
straighter line, 85mph and a touch short, worked down to the leg side and they scuttle through
short ball, too straight and the ball doesn't bounce as much as Taylor would like, allowing Roy to get on top of a short-arm jab and send it whizzing through backward square leg for four more
back of a length and tucked into the leg side from the crease
short and down the leg side - not a great start
dug in, rising towards the ribs but Roy just bounces up and forces it away through backward square, a fast outfield keeping the ball just out of Taylor's reach all the way to the rope
fuller, check-driven back down the ground, Holder sticks out a paw to stop it
better line and length from Holder, 82mph and hitting the seam as Roy pushes forward and is beaten outside off
pitched up, touch wide and he can free his arms, punched straight to backward point, though
back of a length, 80mph and rising around off stump, steered to cover point
good length on off, straightens a touch off the seam and Roy adjusts to cover the line, tapped back down the track
short and rising outside off, 85mph but YJB rides it and dabs one down into the off side
good length, Roy flails at a drive but there's no timing as it rolls to cover
short and hammered, a whippy roundhouse from Roy and he spanks it square, too quick for deep midwicket to get around and that's four more
good length from Taylor, teasing line and Roy leaves alone
Roy starts walking down, short of a length from Taylor and shaping away as he dabs at it and misses
this comes back, touching 89mph and seaming in as Roy leaves, well judged as it zips through past off
short and tucked for four more, just a flick off the hips and it skips away
touch back of a length outside off and tapped into the covers
better stuff from Holder, fourth-stump line and YJB can't do much as he comes forward and inside edges to leg
in the channel, left alone as it rises through to the keeper
fullish, takes the edge but flies wide of slip! No second slip in and it goes quickly, but well stopped by the sliding fielder at third man to save a couple
gets on to the front foot to defend
shaping away and left alone
that's a good nut from Taylor, fired in and straightening off the seam as Bairstow pushes forward
back of a length, opens the face on one to third man
short of a length, rising up to clip the inside edge
driven from the crease, standing tall but picks out cover
touch short again and Roy again stiff-arm jabs the ball along the carpet to the edge of the ring - good over from Taylor, just one off it
length on the stumps YJB nurdles one more off the pads to the right of mid-on
Roy comes across and steers a length ball between midwicket and mid-on for another single
shorter, Roy rocks back and dabs at the ball, doesn't connect
fullish in the channel, punched in front of square but again can't get it through
back of a length outside off, 80mph and glided down to third man
fired in straight and worked through the leg side for a couple more
straightening in the channel, takes the outside edge but drops short of slip! Bairstow nearly caught fishing, though Gayle didn't have a hope of getting his hands under that one
89mph full toss, Roy skips out and bludgeons it back down the ground! He actually checked the shot after contact but still it scorched away past mid-off to the rope
on off stump, punched back to the bowler
touch short and wide, crashed through the covers by Roy as he comes forward - princely timing, four more!
good length, 85mph on off stump, this time he steers it deftly towards mid-off and they scamper through
short of a length outside off, tapped down towards gully
Roy moves menacingly down the pitch again and jabs a rising ball fine of mid-on, Cummins does well to get across and prevent it running away
length on off, 80mph and nurdled to the leg side as YJB makes sure to get Roy back on strike
back of a length and punched towards extra cover, again they steal a run
short and rising outside off, Bairstow rocks back and angles the bat for one to third man
dug in, Roy swivels and pulls flat to the leg-side sweeper for another single
short of a length outside off, dabbed towards backward point
length ball, 86mph and Roy sashays across, miscues a whip to leg but it falls short into the off side
back of a length, wide of the stumps, Roy opens his shoulders and clubs the ball back through mid-off for four more! Boshed
tighter line, short and angled to backward point with an open face
pitched up, 86mph and drilled straight back from whence it came, Taylor manages to get something on it
good length, off-stump line and this is defended watchfully back down the track
full and worked along the carpet to mid-on as Roy moves across his stumps again
shortish outside off and dabbed behind square
Roy comes walking down, ends up blocking a length ball into the off side, YJB hustles through for one more
pushed in with the arm and Bairstow nudges it around the corner, deep square leg has to run in a long way and he comes haring back down for the second, safely in
length outside off, Bairstow is untroubled in guiding another single to third man
pitched up and driven firmly, Holder gets a hand on it and Bairstow is left on his knees as he whirls around trying to get back into his ground
fullish, punched through mid-on
short and wide, bit of a loosener and Roy whups it past mid-on and away for four
straighter, on a length and sliding in to hit the pads, Hope appeals for lbw but Joseph wasn't interested
short, 87mph and pulled hard and flat but straight to midwicket
not a bad ball but Roy creams it for four more! Driven on the up, just a checked-push but it zips back past the umpire and away
dug in, Roy pulls, sweetly struck but just one to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, guided down to third man
Holder drops short and YJB paddles a single down to fine leg
good length, 80mph on the stumps, Roy gets an inside edge into the leg side
angled in with the arm and worked away square for a single
back of a length outside off, bit too close to cut and YJB swishes and misses
full on middle and off, clipped firmly down the ground but long-on keeps them to one
short and rising in the channel, Roy rides it and steers one through point... and that's his fifty, generously applauded on his home ground. His first in ODIs since March in Antigua
shortish on the hip and worked down square on the leg side
comes down early, nearly turning the ball into a half-volley but his slug down the ground ends up deflecting on to his boot... not quite to the same extent as Lewis earlier, though
in the channel, dabbed behind square on the off side
touch short and straight, 85mph, Bairstow clips it to deep backward square leg
good length, Roy strong-arms an on-drive wide of long-on for a couple
fullish, tucked into the on side for one more
pitched up and chopped into the covers without timing
short from Holder and Roy swivels to blap four more unceremoniously to deep backward square
a rather tame bumper from Holder, this sits up for Roy to crack through backward square for another boundary
another half-cracker, this time Roy muscles it powerfully square but straight to the man protecting the boundary
too straight, on the hips and Bairstow just nudges it away fine... off the padding, actually, but they all count
length in the channel, dabbed down to third man
banged in short outside off and pulled square for one
pitched up, 85mph and clumped back down the ground to long-on
length in the channel, tapped towards cover coming forwards
back of a length, too straight and again Bairstow just works it off his hip for four fine of the man on the rope
angled in and flicked for one to fine leg this time

full length, Roy doesn't muck about, clearing his front leg to club England's first six straight back into the sightscreen, bringing up the 100 in the process! That went like a comet, all it needed was a flaming tail...
short outside off and run down to third man again
tighter line and Roy pushes it without conviction into the off side
pitched up, nudged back down the ground for one as he comes forward
hits the pitch halfway down, again Bairstow is happy to sit deep and run the ball to third man
back of a length, 88mph and clipped off the hip towards deep midwicket, they wanted two but Roy slipped, I think
fullish, 85mph and wide of the stumps as Bairstow slashes it down to third man off the toe
short outside off, cut to deep cover
that goes very wrong, he's overstepped and dragged down a short ball, Roy just helps it round the corner fine of the keeper
heaved down the ground, one bounce to long-on
full outside off, no timing in this drive as he finds cover
clubbed to mid-off on the front front
full and straight, digs it out towards mid-on who is deep enough to allow the single
length ball outside off, 83mph, Roy drives firmly and again finds Gayle at cover...no need to over-hit, his timing is so good
short ball, 87mph, hurries Bairstow a little as he pulls and finds deep square
what a shot! As I was saying about Roy's timing...he was lofted this miles over long-on (and it's another no-ball). Stood still and just drove through the line
again he misses out on the free hit, it's short of a length outside off and he's through the swipe early, sends it to cover
works a straight delivery through the leg side
edged behind! Out of nowhere, really. Back of a length outside off, Roy trying to run it to third man and he's gifted his wicket. A comeback century goes begging, but a very fine innings nonetheless
short of a length, gets inside the line and tucks to midwicket
that's a very short bouncer, flies over Root's head and is called a wide
back on a good length outside off, opens the face and finds point who can't stop it cleanly and they steal a single
some movement in from outside off, defended to cover
that's a lovely shot, dropped in short and Root in complete control as he plays a swivel-pull behind square
back of a length, stays back in the crease and whips it down to long leg
full at off stump, driven to cover
good length at the stumps, worked towards mid-on and more good running
onto the front foot, drives on the up into a good length ball and finds mid-off
another short ball, the pull finds long leg
88mph, full outside off, driven to mid-off
another ripping pull shot by Root, picks the length so early and sends it behind square
driven back to the bowler
short of a length, rolls his wrists on another pull out to deep square
full at the stumps, whipped to deep midwicket
full at off stump, aims to steer it down to third man but the keeper is able to cut it off
full outside, driven to mid-off
a dive from Gayle at cover (yes, indeed) as Bairstow drives on the up
opens the face against a good length delivery and finds a gap at cover, Gayle is rather more sluggish to pick this one up
forward outside off stump, drives and finds the fielder at mid-off
worked off the stumps with a flick of the wrists, out to deep midwicket, a decent over from Cummins
there's not much for short today, this is pulled to deep square leg
guided to the keeper! Almost a carbon copy of Roy's wicket, Bairstow just trying to guide a short-of-a-length delivery to third man and finds the gloves of Hope
very full outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, defended to mid-off
short of a length, defended into the covers
edged! Through the gap. Would you believe it! There's a first and third slip, Morgan slashes at a short-of-a-length delivery and flies through second slip
on the pads, clipped to long leg
short of a length on leg stump, flicked off the hip very fine but fine leg is able to get across to cut it off
what a gem! That will make him feel better, strides forward and pings a cover drive through the off-side field
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, defended
touch fuller, at off stump, played cautiously
touch too full outside off, he gets forward and drives square through the off side to deep point
uses his feet, almost runs at the bowler, then pushes and scampers towards mid-off
he's been given caught behind! Joseph has three...dropped in short, that's normally meant runs today, but this time he gets a thin bottom edge...more toe end, in fact
full outside off, left alone
what a piece of timing that is, walks across the crease and takes a length delivery from outside off through straight midwicket
right across the crease again, short of a length, pushed into the covers
slashed in the air down to third man, through his hands into a delivery wide outside off
round the wicket, speared down the leg side
slides on with the air, opens the face and pushes through point
over the wicket, full outside off, and that's a delightful drive wide of mid-off, just strode forward and placed it with his wrists
slower this one, worked down the ground to long-on
full toss, goes for the reverse sweep and gets enough bat on it to clear the man at short third man
down the leg side, not given a wide...must have taken the pad
flicks a straight delivery to midwicket
close with a direct hit! Buttler played a length ball into the leg side, Morgan was looking for the run, Joseph darted across from his follow through and with a direct hit Morgan was gone
drives to point, was in the air for a while
short of a length outside off, angled down to third man
a short delivery, pulled towards deep square leg. Goes one bounce to the fielder
walks into a length delivery and pushes to the covers
what a catch! And what a day for Joseph. Short on leg stump, Morgan picks it up with a pull, doesn't even try to keep it down. Kyle Hope, the sub, leaps at long leg and plucks it out of the sky
works a length delivery through midwicket
full outside off, tapped to cover
pushed with a straight bat down the ground to get off the mark
back of a length, walks at the medium pace and pushes down the ground
short of a length, another one eased down the ground
driven on the up and finds cover

Gayle has grabbed a blinder at slip and it's five for Joseph! Billings again moving across his crease, aims to work a short-of-a-length delivery to the leg side, gets an outside edge which is going to Gayle's right. He dives low and grabs it inches off the turf. Brilliant stuff
short of a length at off stump, defended on his toes to the covers
on middle and off, played to the covers
short outside off, he's in form and pulls it through straight midwicket
full and wide outside off, goes for a big drive and misses
full outside off, edged but well wide of the slips to third man
short of a length outside off, worked down to long-on
walks across the stumps and flicks to deep square leg
short outside leg stump, flicked in the air behind square
pushed down to long-off
just short of a length, dragged deep into the leg side
back of a length, worked into the leg side...West Indies content to give singles away
round the wicket, tucked off the pads to deep square leg
pushed into the off side
that's a thumping blow, stands in his crease and muscles a full delivery straight down the ground
drags the length back, straighter, worked into the leg side
brings out the slog sweep, a full delivery outside off, finds deep midwicket
worked off the pads to short fine leg
on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
hint of seam movement, defeats Buttler's on-the-up drive outside off
that's a poor piece of fielding, driven square towards point who dives over the top of it
touch fuller and straight, he finds mid-off
not far from bowling him, aiming to whip a low full toss and misses it...scoots past off stump
full and wide outside off, driven to cover where Gayle gets down to his right
that's a clean hit...skips down the pitch and produces a lovely free swing of the arms to clear deep midwicket
this time he goes straighter, was a short delivery but he just went through with a clubbing strike back over the bowler's head
he's on the charge! Goes down on his back knee and slog sweeps a full delivery high over wide long-on
fuller, wide outside off, drilled along the ground to long-off
dragged down short but Buttler can only punch it back to the bowler
on the pads, nudged into the leg side and the placement is perfect for the second
round the wicket, full outside off, a very powerful drive as Moeen leans back, beats Gayle at cover
length ball at off stump, worked into midwicket
a little shimmy in the crease, Holder holds his nerve and keeps it full outside off, driven through the covers wide of the sweeper
excellent delivery, an off-stump yorker, can only dig it out to backward point
a loopy full toss slower ball, gets away with it as Moeen drives to cover
well bowled, angled in at Moeen who can only push it back to Holder...good over
short ball, 84mph as Buttler walks down and pulls, gets a glove into the leg side
full outside off, Moeen flashes hard and Samuels can't grab it at backward point! Not sure he even got a hand on it, the ball was travelling... Tecnically a drop, though
pitched up and Moeen slugs hard again, thick-edges down to third man for one
full and straight, Buttler shimmies and ramps - and sends it fine for four! Takes the yorker and sticks a flake it in
angled in, turned to the leg side for one
pitched up and flayed through the covers for four more! Moeen crunches a half-volley to the cover fence
pitched up and turned off the pads into the leg side for another single
full and wide of off, in the slot and Moeen drills it over mid-off, Holder throwing himself in vain! England are flying here, got the Big Mo on their side again!
pitched up and this time Moeen tips and runs towards mid-off
fired in full, Buttler again plinks a single into the leg side
full outside off, 85mph and Moeen squirts it straight to backward point
low full toss, swinging a touch, 86mph and Moeen whups it through the covers, the crowd cheers for the single... and it skids all the way for four!
slower ball, Buttler moves across and tickles it off his pads
